citation: Davis, F. D. (1989). Perceived usefulness, perceived ease of use, and user acceptance of information technology. MIS Quarterly, 13(3), 319-340.
method: Lab experiment with 107 users, two applications
findings: Both PU and PEOU significantly predict behavioral intention. PU has stronger effect.
summary: Foundational TAM paper establishing PU and PEOU as key predictors of technology adoption.
replicationNotes: Scale items widely replicated. Consider moderators (experience, voluntariness).

citation: Bhattacherjee, A. (2001). Understanding information systems continuance: An expectation-confirmation model. MIS Quarterly, 25(3), 351-370.
findings: Confirmation affects both PU and satisfaction. Both predict continuance intention.
summary: ECM extends ECT to IS context, adding PU as post-adoption belief.
replicationNotes: Applicable to voluntary systems. Consider habit formation for long-term use.
